text:
If the authnz_svn access file contains an entry for a repository that does not
exist, then a "Could not open the requested SVN filesystem" error is thrown when
an autenticated and authorized user tries to access the url.

Example:

John Doe tries to access the url https://svn.something.org/RepoA.

The access file contains the entry

[RepoA:/]
john_doe = rw

but RepoA does not exist in svnparenpath.

I use ldap authentication, if that is relevant. My system is SLES 10.1 sp 1.

Good luck!

/Magnus
creator: magnus.gafvert@modelon.se

text:
This seems to be a subversion issue. So please open a bug in the subversion
tracker (http://subversion.tigris.org/project_issues.html). Apart from this I
guess it would be real helpful telling them which version of subversion you are
using :-).
creator: rpluem@apache.org
